src:
Skoraj osem milijonov evrov za prenovo Titovega Galeba
05 Nov 2019, 17:36 by STA

Ladja Galeb, ki je zaslovela, ker jo je uporabljal bivši jugoslovanski predsednik Josip Broz Tito, naj bi kmalu dočakala prenovo. Po številnih zapletih s financiranjem projekta je reška mestna uprava na javnem razpisu izbrala izvajalca prenove 117 metrov dolge ladje. Vrednost prenovitvenih del je ocenjena na skoraj osem milijonov evrov.



Več kot dve tretjini od 4500 kvadratnih metrov površine Galeba bodo namenili muzejskemu pregledu njegove zgodovine in režimov, ki so se menjavali na Reki. Foto: Profimedia

REKA > Na ponovljenem javnem razpisu za izvajalca prenovitvenih del na Galebu so minuli teden izbrali ladjedelnico Dalmont iz Kraljevice, so sporočili iz oddelka za javno nabavo mesta Reka. Kot so dodali, so poleg Dalmontove ponudbe, ki je znašala 58,5 milijona kun (7,9 milijona evrov), prejeli tudi ponudbo reške remontne ladjedelnice Viktor Lenac, ki je dosegla 75,8 milijona kun (10,2 milijona evrov).
Če do sredine novembra ne bo pritožb na izbiro cenovno bolj ugodne ponudbe, bodo po poročanju Novega lista s kraljevško ladjedelnico podpisali pogodbo o prenovi Galeba.
Potopljena, dvignjena, prodana, kupljenaLadjo Galeb so izdelali leta 1938 v Genovi za prevoz sadja. Med drugo svetovno vojno so jo uporabljali za polaganje min v Kvarnerju, leta 1944 pa je po napadu zavezniških bombnikov končala na dnu Jadrana. Leta 1948 so jo jugoslovanski delavci izvlekli na gladino, od leta 1953 pa je kot Titova rezidenčna ladja obiskala več kot 40 pristanišč v Evropi, Aziji in Afriki. Po razpadu nekdanje Jugoslavije so ladjo prepeljali v Črno goro. Prodali so jo Grku Johnu Paulu Papanikolauju, ki je plovilo želel prenoviti v luksuzno jahto v ladjedelnici Viktor Lenac na Reki, a se je zapletlo pri plačilu. Mesto jo je kupilo leta 2009, potem ko je propadala v reški ladjedelnici. Ladja je zaščitena kot hrvaška kulturna dediščina.
V reškem mestnem svetu so konec septembra po burni razpravi sprejeli odločitev o najemu dodatnih 44 milijonov kun (5,9 milijona evrov) posojila, da bi lahko zagotovili izvedbo projekta prenove ladje in zaščitene industrijske dediščine upravnega poslopja nekdanje reške tovarne sladkorja. Na ta način so se tudi izognili nevarnosti, da bi morali vrniti 69 milijonov kun (9,3 milijona evrov), ki so jih za prenovo Galeba in nekdanje tovarne sladkorja dobili iz skladov EU.


29. avgusta 1963 sta z Brionov v Koper z ladjo Galeb priplula predsednik Tito in sovjetski premier Nikita Hruščev. (foto: arhiv PN)

Evropska unija je odobrila 85 odstotkov sredstev za prenovo zaščitene kulturne in industrijske dediščine. Mesto Reka je najprej ocenilo, da bo za prenovo Galeba zadostovalo nekaj manj kot 34 milijonov kun (4,5 milijona evrov), na prvem neuspešnem razpisu pa so na podlagi ponudb ugotovili, da bo prenova občutno dražja.
Reka prihodnje leto evropska prestolnica kulture
Največje hrvaško pristanišče bo prihodnje leto evropska prestolnica kulture. Organizatorji zgodovinskega projekta hrvaške kulture so pričakovali, da bo prenovljeni Galeb prve turiste sprejel poleti prihodnje leto. Nekateri sicer dvomijo, da bodo zahtevna obnovitvena dela končana, kot je bilo predvideno.


Ena izmed spalnic na ladji Galeb. Fotografirano leta 2017. (foto: Profimedia)

Ko bodo ladjo odprli za obiskovalce, bo možen ogled rezidenčnega dela plovila, v katerem je Tito preživljal čas med številnimi svetovnimi potovanji. Na Galebu so med drugim sprožili pobudo za ustanovitev gibanja neuvrščenih, a ladje po zatrjevanju reške mestne uprave ne bodo uporabljali za poveličevanje katerekoli zgodovinske osebe.
Muzej na vodi
Več kot dve tretjini od 4500 kvadratnih metrov površine Galeba bodo namenili muzejskemu pregledu njegove zgodovine in režimov, ki so se menjavali na Reki. Preostale prostore bodo uredili za gostinske storitve kot tudi za gledališke in filmske predstave, tribune in delavnice. Prenovljeni Galeb bo zasidran ob glavnem pomolu potniškega pristanišča.
text:
Almost eight million euros to renovate Tito's Seagull
05 Nov 2019, 17:36 by STA

The Galeb ship, famed for being used by former Yugoslav President Josip Broz Tito, is about to undergo renovation. After many complications with the financing of the project, the Rijeka City Administration selected a contractor for the renovation of the 117-meter-long ship in a public tender. The value of the renovation works is estimated at almost eight million euros.



More than two-thirds of Galeb's 4,500-square-foot area will be devoted to a museum review of its history and the regimes that have changed on the River. Photo: Profimedia

RIVER> Last week, a Dalmont shipyard from Kraljevica was selected as the contractor for the renovation work at the Seagull last week, according to the Rijeka Public Procurement Department. In addition, in addition to Dalmont's offer of 58.5 million kunas (7.9 million euros), they also received the offer of Rijeka's shipyard Viktor Lenac, which reached 75.8 million kunas (10.2 million euros).
If there are no appeals to choose a more affordable offer by mid-November, a contract to renew the Seagull will be signed with the Royal Shipyard, according to Novi List.
Submerged, raised, sold, boughtLadjo Galeb was made in Genoa in 1938 for fruit transport. During World War II, it was used to mine mines in Kvarner, and in 1944 it ended up at the bottom of the Adriatic after the Allied bombers attacked. In 1948, Yugoslav workers pulled her to the surface, and since 1953 she has visited more than 40 ports in Europe, Asia and Africa as Tito's resident ship. After the collapse of the former Yugoslavia, the ship was transported to Montenegro. It was sold to the Greek John Paul Papanikolaou, who wanted to convert the vessel into a luxury yacht at Viktor Lenac Shipyard on the River, but it was complicated to pay. The city bought it in 2009 after it collapsed in a shipyard in Rijeka. The ship is protected as a Croatian cultural heritage.
At the end of September, after a heated debate, the City Council of Rijeka decided to borrow an additional 44 million kunas (5.9 million euros) to secure the completion of a project to renovate the former sugar factory's ship building and industrial heritage. In this way, they also avoided the risk of having to repay the 69 million kunas (€ 9.3 million) received from EU funds for the refurbishment of the Seagull and the former sugar factory.


On August 29, 1963, President Tito and Soviet Prime Minister Nikita Khrushchev sailed from the Brijuni Islands to Koper. (photo: PN archive)

The European Union has approved 85% of the funding for the renovation of the protected cultural and industrial heritage. The City of Rijeka first estimated that just under 34 million kunas (4.5 million euros) would be sufficient to renovate the Seagull, and on the first unsuccessful tender, the bids were found to be significantly more expensive.
River European Capital of Culture next year
Croatia's largest port will be the European Capital of Culture next year. Organizers of a historic project of Croatian culture expected the renovated Seagull to welcome its first tourists in the summer of next year. Some, however, doubt that the demanding renovation work will be completed as intended.


One of the bedrooms aboard the Seagull. Photographed in 2017. (Photo: Profimedia)

When the boat is opened for visitors, it will be possible to see the residence of the vessel during which Tito spent time during many world voyages. The Galeb has, among other things, launched an initiative to set up an unlisted movement, but the ships will not be used to glorify any historical figure, according to the Rijeka City Administration.
Water Museum
More than two-thirds of Galeb's 4,500-square-foot area will be devoted to a museum review of its history and the regimes that have been changing on the River. The remaining premises will be arranged for catering services as well as theater and film performances, stands and workshops. The refurbished Seagull will be anchored at the main pier of the passenger dock.
